edu.wmich.cs1120.TThompson.LA2

Interface Inode

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TreeDataStructure

    public interface Inode

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addChild(java.lang.String ID, java.lang.String parentID)
      This method creates a new Node and adds it to the children of the node it was called on if its ID matches the parentID, otherwise it looks through all its children
      Inode find(java.lang.String value)
      Looks within the tree to find if value is contained in that subtree.
      java.lang.String getId()
      Function to get the ID of the node.
      Inode getParent()
      Gets the parent of that node.
      void printTree()
      Prints the node upon which this method is called as well as all the children node.
      int size()
      Gets the size of the tree.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Converts the data into a string and returns it For example, Node A has 2 children B and C.

    • Method Detail

      • addChild

        boolean addChild(java.lang.String ID,
               java.lang.String parentID)
        This method creates a new Node and adds it to the children of the node it was called on if its ID matches the parentID, otherwise it looks through all its children
        Parameters:
        ID - contains the id data, parentID contains the parent id
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise

      • find

        Inode find(java.lang.String value)
        Looks within the tree to find if value is contained in that subtree. The node you use to call the find function acts as the root of the tree.
        Parameters:
        value - a string to be found in the tree
        Returns:
        the node if found.

      • getParent

        Inode getParent()
        Gets the parent of that node.
        Returns:
        the parent node of the Node that is used to call this function.

      • size

        int size()
        Gets the size of the tree.
        Returns:
        the size of the tree starting from the node that is used to call this function, all the way down to the leaf nodes.

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Converts the data into a string and returns it For example, Node A has 2 children B and C. A.toString() will return A B C
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of the node.

      • getId

        java.lang.String getId()
        Function to get the ID of the node.
        Returns:
        String representation of the node ID

      • printTree

        void printTree()
        Prints the node upon which this method is called as well as all the children node. Use the toString() format to print.
